The attack, described as Australia’s deadliest terror incident, was carried out by two gunmen, identified by authorities as a father and son. One shooter was killed at the scene. Victims included a rabbi, a Holocaust survivor, and a 10-year-old girl. Australia’s spy agency confirmed it had previously investigated one of the attackers for links to ISIL.

title: Russian court bans Pussy Riot group from working in Russia
snippets: Anti-Kremlin punk band 'Pussy Riot' designated an extremist group by Russian court Reuters

The Russian anti-Kremlin feminist punk band and art collective known as Pussy Riot was designated an extremist organization by a Moscow court on Monday, banning its activities inside Russia as part of a wider crackdown on dissenting voices.
titles: Anti-Kremlin punk band 'Pussy Riot' designated an extremist group by Russian court - Reuters

constructiveness_reason: semantic: pos_sim=0.00, neg_sim=0.00; length_penalty=0.60 (<20 tokens)
summary: A Moscow court has designated the anti-Kremlin punk band and art collective Pussy Riot as an extremist organization, banning its activities within Russia. This move is part of a broader effort by Russian authorities to suppress dissent. The group is now prohibited from operating in the country.

title: Merriam-Webster’s 2025 word of the year is ‘slop’
snippets: Merriam-Webster has settled on a word that represents 2025 - and that word is "slop." The dictionary-maker defines "slop" as "digital content of low quality that is produced usually in quantity by means of artificial intelligence," something that many people have become familiar with as AI-generated
AI-generated content has dominated the internet over the past year, and America's dictionary took note.

title: WATCH:  Video shows moment heroic bystander wrestles gun from alleged Bondi Beach shooter
snippets: Video shared with ABC News shows the moment a heroic bystander wrestled a gun away from the hands of one of the alleged shooters at Australia's Bondi Beach on Sunday.
Australian Prime Minister Anthony Albanese identified the man being hailed a hero as Ahmed al-Ahmed and said he was injured during the attack.
The video, verified by The New York Times, shows a man sneaking up on one of the shooters who targeted a Hanukkah celebration in Sydney on Sunday.
